title: [Medicine] Vitamin D sufficiency, a serum 25-hydroxyvitamin D at least 30 ng/mL reduced risk for adverse clinical outcomes in patients with COVID-19. Improving vitamin D status has a potential benefit in reducing the severity of morbidities and mortality associated with COVID-19.

[Health] People hospitalized with severe COVID-19 are at increased risk for cardiac arrest. Analysis of registry records from a New York City health system reveals the in-hospital survival rates for cardiac arrest dropped by 10% among COVID-19 patients compared to 2019 data.
